through the back of the stitch one row below the first stitch has been increased stitch on your left needle knit the next stitch through the back loop kitchener stitch stockinette one stitch has been increased kitchener stitch is used to create a seamless look in your knitting the most common place to find it used is the toe m1l make 1 left of a sock this increase causes the new stitch to slant to the left step 1 thread a tapestry needle with the long tail at the knit through the left leg of the stitch one row below the first end of your knitting or use another length of matching stitch on your right needle yarn one stitch increased step 2 divide your stitches evenly between 2 needles and hold needles parallel to each other make sure the rs of p2tog purl 2 stitches togther the fabric face out and both needle tips point in the same insert needle through 2 sts and purl them together as one direction step 3 insert tapestry needle into the first stitch on the ssk slip slip knit front
